snippet: Commissioner Bud Selig recalled A. Bartlett Giamatti, the former commissioner who died of a heart attack eight days after banning Pete Rose from baseball in 1989.
abstract: MLB commissioner Bud Selig refers to former Commissioner A Bartlett Giamatti several times in his first public comments since suspending New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez and 12 other players connected with the Biogenesis doping scandal; Selig says the weight of the decision reminded him of the stress for Giamatti, who died in 1989 eight days after barring Pete Rose from baseball.
lead_paragraph: Commissioner Bud Selig recalled A. Bartlett Giamatti, the former commissioner who died of a heart attack eight days after banning Pete Rose from baseball in 1989.

headline.main: Selig Says the Recent Suspensions Weighed on Him
headline.print_headline: In First Comments Since Suspensions, Selig Recalls Stress of Rose Case
